discourse_list.title: Survey Makerdao CU employees on their workplace satisfaction

content.content: Workplace satisfaction has a major impact on productivity. It’s useful for Makerdao to understand how the people working for the DAO feel. It impacts expected turnover and provides key insights on how the DAO functions. Is any CU willing to own this initiative? Some Sample Questions Rate 1-5 I am given the resources to do my job. This is a friendly place to work. Delegates and Maker Holders make their expectations clear. I can ask management any reasonable question and get a straight answer.

content.content: I have worked at a number of places both public and private. To date I have never been presented with such a survey and for the most part middle to upper management in these places actually didn’t care. What they started to care about.  Workplace harassment or abuse (both emotional or sexual). Whether you are planning to leave.  They care about (1) because of liability and (2) because they just want to know whether they are going to have to replace someone.   As a freelance consultant no-one cared at all about how I felt working for them because I could be replaced at the drop of a hat if I complained.   I guess at $200+/hr no-one wants to hear your whining, just go find another client/job. If anyone is going to do a survey make sure to ask some basic status questions.  How old are you? (age bracket answers) Are you M/F or other? Do you have higher education degrees? a) How many? b) Highest level. How long have you worked for the DAO? Are you an employee or consultant? How did you find out about MakerDAO?  Then a few survey questions that come to mind which could give some indications about how a person feels about their job.  Is your compensation, below market, at market, or above market in your opinion? If you were laid off tomorrow do you feel you could find another job with comparable compensation and benefits Is it harder or easier working for MakerDAO than your past employment Is your supervisor a person or the DAO? Do you like your supervisor? How often do you report to your supervisor? Does your supervisor help you grow in your career? Do you feel your supervisor is supportive or abrasive? Would you recommend to another person working for Maker?  Why or why not? If you were ever sick did your workplace/supervisor support you? Do you get vacation? Does your job require you to have formal hours? If there was one single thing MakerDAO could do to help you better succeed both at performing your job and being productive at your job what would that be? Rank how much MakerDAO governance affects you in your job (0 - not at all, 5 - completely dependent on governance actions for good or bad) List specific workplace issues you would like to see addressed. Have you ever felt harassed or abused while working at MakerDAO? Are you planning to leave MakerDAO in the next 1-2 years?

content.content: This isn’t a bad idea but where would the information go and who would be responsible for implementing any actionable feedback?  These types of things are generally handled at an upper management level.  It might make more sense for each CU to create their own individual workplace satisfaction survey, rather than one CU creating a survey for the entire DAO.

content.content: On that note, there are well established practices for survey methodology in the organizational behavior literature. In general, each CU should be responsible for their own reporting and management of their personnel and satisfaction. If there is to be a DAO wide initiative, there would need to be a managing CU, responsible for aggregating, analyzing, and reporting the data. There would also need to be spend attached. The best suited CU to do this would be SES, but unless they volunteer for something like this we should table it until some organizational changes are in place, whatever they may be.
